TI: Intracellular targeting of calmodulin mRNAs in primary hippocampal cells.
AB: We investigated the intracellular distribution of the mRNAs corresponding to the three non-allelic CaM genes in cultured hippocampal cells by in situ hybridization with digoxigenin-labeled gene-specific riboprobes. In neurons the perikaryon was heavily stained and strong dendritic mRNA targeting was detected for all three CaM genes. The color labeling exhibited a punctate distribution, suggesting that CaM mRNAs are transported in RNA granules. Immunocytochemistry for S100 demonstrated that glial cells express CaM mRNAs at a very low level. A minority of the cultured cells were negative for either labeling.
AD: Department of Zoology and Cell Biology, University of Szeged, Szeged, Hungary.
JT: The journal of histochemistry and cytochemistry : official journal of the Histochemistry Society
